subsection_analysis.section_title: • Grasse: Attend the Rose Festival in May, celebrating the town's famous flower.
subsection_analysis.refined_text: • Marseille: Experience the Fête de la Musique in June, with free concerts and performances throughout the city.

subsection_analysis.document: South of France - Things to Do_1753555810969.pdf
subsection_analysis.section_title: • Pyrenees: Take a cable car ride for stunning mountain views and easy hiking trails.
subsection_analysis.refined_text: • Dordogne: Explore the region's caves and prehistoric sites with guided tours suitable for children.

subsection_analysis.document: South of France - Things to Do_1753555810969.pdf
subsection_analysis.section_title: • Nîmes: Visit the Roman amphitheater and learn about ancient Roman history.
subsection_analysis.refined_text: • Arles: Explore the Roman ruins and the Musée de l'Arles Antique, which showcases artifacts from the city's past.

subsection_analysis.refined_text: dishes at reasonable prices. The cozy atmosphere and friendly service make it a great spot for a casual meal.
